message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about combining neural machine translation (NMT) with traditional statistical machine translation (SMT) using a novel scheme. The paper focuses on improving the translation quality by minimizing the Bayes risk with respect to syntactic translation lattices. This topic falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine translation, which is covered by the cs.CL sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new approach that combines ideas from linearized lattice minimum Bayes-risk decoding for SMT, which involves optimization and machine learning techniques, making it relevant to the cs.LG and cs.AI sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of subword-unit-level NMT, which is related to the cs.NE sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on English-German and Japanese-English datasets, which involves computer vision techniques, making it relevant to the cs.CV sub-category.
